meta.subject: South African Sign Language Home Language P1

questions.text: Which President introduced the banning of elephant hunting?
model_answers: Former President of Botswana, Ian Khama.

questions.text: What was the reason for the ban against the hunting of elephants on public land?
model_answers: There was a decline in the number of elephants in Botswana.

questions.text: Name the Act that monitored hunting in private game ranches.
model_answers: Wildlife Conservation and National Parks Act.
questions.notes: Full name of Act is required in the answer. Signing or fingerspelling even if incorrect, is accepted provided that the meaning is not changed.
questions.topic: Wildlife Conservation and National Parks Act

questions.text: Refer to chunk 2. Give the 3 main points of the Committee's Report.
model_answers: Hunting would boost tourism.
Culling would control the national elephant population.
Meat from culled animals could be canned for animal food.

questions.text: How long did the ban on hunting elephants last, before the review?
model_answers: 4 Years
From 2014 to 2018
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any ONE of the above.

questions.text: What are Botswana's two largest sources of foreign income?
model_answers: Diamond mining
Tourism

questions.text: Refer to chunk 3. Compare the attitudes of the rural citizens and the wildlife conservationists towards hunting of elephants.
model_answers: The wildlife conservationists wanted to protect the elephants / did not want the elephants to be killed.
The rural citizens supported hunting / killing of elephants.

questions.text: Refer to chunk 4. Explain the reason for the attitude of the rural citizens towards the hunting of elephants. Give two reasons.
model_answers: The elephants destroyed crops and there was less food for families.
The elephants destroyed crops, leaving no crops to sell. The elephants killed people while they protected their farms.
The elephants destroyed the farmers’ homes.
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any TWO of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Is this statement an opinion or a fact?
model_answers: Opinion

questions.text: Give a reason for this.
model_answers: The number of elephants is an approximate number.
The number of elephants is guessed.
The number of elephants is not specific / accurate.
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any ONE of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: In what way have international tourists disadvantaged Botswana?
model_answers: The tourists come to Botswana to hunt wildlife and have reduced the wildlife population.

questions.text: 'The number of elephants in Botswana is estimated to be about 130,000 which is overloading the ecosystem.' What does this mean?
model_answers: B: Ecosystem is unstable.

questions.text: Do you think lifting the ban will be good for Botswana? Refer to the text and give three reasons for your answer.

positives: Lifting of the hunting ban will result in safari companies being available for tourists to visit Botswana to hunt.
The unemployed hunters will have job opportunities in safari companies.
Botswana will receive more foreign income from tourists.
The crops of rural communities will be safe.
negatives: Animal wildlife conservationists will lose their jobs.
Animal lovers won't visit Botswana as their tourist destination.

questions.marker_instruction: Accept any THREE of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Why does the president need to make a fair, final decision on removing or retaining the ban?
model_answers: He has to ensure that the local rural communities are happy and safe.
He has to ensure that tourism in Botswana continues to grow.
He has to consider that elephants do not become extinct.
He has to ensure that the elephants are protected.
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any THREE of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Refer to Text B and chunk 4 in Text A. In what other ways could the government assist the rural citizens?
model_answers: The government could provide food.
The government could build stronger / good houses.
The government could build fences / walls around the properties.
The government could provide seeds / crops for farming.
The government could ensure that properties are patrolled.
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any TWO of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Refer to Text B and chunk 4 in Text A. Critically evaluate whether Text B is a true reflection of what is being signed in chunk 4.

positives: Text B shows the elephant trampling over and destroying valuable crops.
Text B shows that the elephant has destroyed the source of food and the livelihood of the community.
Text B shows the elephant approaching the homes of the community.
negatives: Text B shows the elephant walking through a previously harvested crop.
Text B does not show the elephant attacking people.
Text B does not show the elephant eating the vegetation.
Text B shows the elephant walking in its natural habitat.

questions.marker_instruction: Accept TWO of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Refer to Text B. Do you think that elephants should be hunted as a sport? Give two reasons.

positives: Elephants would no longer cause the destruction of crops and people will have food to eat.
The livelihood of people will be maintained, as they will have crops to sell.
Attacks on people will be minimised.
negatives: Hunting of the elephants would lead to extinction.
Baby elephants would be left to fend for themselves.
This is contradictory to preservation of life.
Elephants are not aware that they are being destructive.

questions.marker_instruction: Any TWO of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: SUMMARISING IN YOUR OWN WORDS
model_answers: As exams come closer stress increases but there are ways to overcome this.
Know when the exams are and manage your time well so that there is enough time to study.
It is important to take breaks while studying by going out for a walk with your pet or have a cup of tea outside.
Drink healthy drinks like water and green tea instead of excessive amounts high energy drinks like Red Bull.
It would be better to eat an apple to sustain energy levels rather than chocolate with high sugar.
Keep your phone off to avoid being distracted by social media and chat groups and you will pass.
Use old exam papers to test yourself and to see if you finish papers in prescribed time.
Working hard over the years and you will be mentally and physically prepared to pass the exams.
Ask for help if this is needed for you to understand your work and for you to pass the exams.
questions.marker_instruction: Any SEVEN valid points in paragraph-form are to be credited. Mark allocation: 7 marks for 7 points (1 mark per main point), 3 marks for language.
questions.notes: Distribution of language marks: 1–3 points: 1 mark; 4–5 points: 2 marks; 6–7 points: 3 marks. If quoted verbatim: 6-7 quotes: 0 marks; 1-5 quotes: 1 mark.

questions.text: What is being advertised?
model_answers: iPad Air 2.

questions.text: Is the iPad equally useful to males and females? How do you know?
model_answers: Yes. The advert shows both males and females using the product. Examples of how males and females use the product differently.

questions.text: Which careers can benefit from the use of this product?
model_answers: Architecture
Technology for vehicles
Farming
Baking
Music
Graphic design
Fashion designer
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any TWO of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: What benefits can the iPad add to a Deaf person's life?
model_answers: Communication
Research
Making learning more visual
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Explain the effect of the downsizing of the screen.
model_answers: The downsizing from full screen to the thinness of the iPad shows the variety of ideas that can be compacted into a thin, small device.
Technology is changing/advancing.

questions.text: The advert focuses on younger people. Why do you think older people are excluded?
model_answers: They are not familiar with technology.
Not many older people will buy the product.
Older people are slower to learn about new technology.
The technology is not needed by older people.

questions.text: Refer to Frame 2. What is the setting?
model_answers: The picture is a burger which shows that the scene is a restaurant / take-away / fast-food outlet / McDonalds.

questions.text: Refer to Frames 3 and 4. Give reasons for the differences in the facial expressions of the man in the red shirt.
model_answers: In Frame 3, the man expresses surprise and shock as he is being put under a spell / he is confused about what is happening to him.
In Frame 4, the man is happy and excited that he is able to communicate in Sign Language / he is pleased at what has happened to him.

questions.text: Refer to Frame 4. What do the short sketch lines around the hand convey?
model_answers: The sketch lines show that there is movement of the hands and this is because the man is signing.
The sketch lines show the direction of the movement of the signing hands.
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any ONE of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Explain the humour in the cartoon.
model_answers: In his dream, the Deaf man wishes that he could cast a spell on the waiter for him to be able to communicate in sign language. The humour is that in reality this cannot happen.

questions.text: Give three figurative reasons to substantiate that this cartoon depicts a dream.
model_answers: In reality it is not possible to wave a wand and make a person sign.
Sign Language must be learnt over time, it is not instant.
Magic only happens in movies and stories and not in real life.
He is dreaming because he hopes for this to happen.
questions.marker_instruction: Accept any THREE of the above or similar responses.

questions.text: Identify the lexicalised fingerspelled sign.
model_answers: OK

questions.text: What type of classifier is indicated in this clip? Sign the same concept using a different classifier.
model_answers: Bodypart classifier (BPCL)
Different classifier: Both hands V-hand shape, Palm down, Move swiftly to the left.

questions.text: Select ONE incorrect sentence from the clip provided. Edit the sentence using the correct SASL structure.
View the clip. Correct the verb to fit the context.
model_answers: The sign for animal chewing: A-handshape on both hands. Palms facing each other. Horizontal symmetry. Dominant hand in circular motion.

questions.text: Is this an example of synecdoche or metonymy? Give a reason for your answer.
model_answers: Synecdoche. The ears signed represent the dog's body.

questions.text: View the two clips. Identify and compare the adverbs.
model_answers: (Adverb of manner.)
The adverb in the first clip shows running at a normal/slower pace.
The adverb in the second clip shows running faster.
